title: Prawn and Fish Ball Soup with Ramen Noodles

ingredients.content: 3 cm ginger, fresh root, peeled, cut in round slices (2 mm)
½ - 1 long red chilli, deseeded and halved
400 g white fish fillets, cut in pieces (4-5 cm)
230 g water chestnuts, whole, tinned, drained
200 g Asian greens (e.g. choy sum, bok choy), trimmed and cut in pieces (3 cm)
2 spring onions, trimmed and thinly sliced

preparations.content: Grease Varoma dish and tray with oil and set aside. Place ginger, spring onions, coriander and chilli in mixing bowl then chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add all remaining fish ball ingredients and chop <b>10 sec/speed 7<b>. With damp hands, shape 2 teaspoons of mixture into walnut-sized balls to make approx. 30 fish and prawn balls. Transfer into greased Varoma and set aside. Rinse and dry mixing bowl.
Insert simmering basket, then weigh in noodles. Remove simmering basket with aid of spatula and set aside.
Place water, stock paste, wine, soy sauce, sesame oil, salt, sugar, shrimp paste (belachan) and star anise in mixing bowl. Place Varoma into position and cook <b>17 min/Varoma/speed 2<b>.
Weigh Asian greens into Varoma dish and tray. Secure Varoma lid and cook <b>2 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>.
Rinse noodles in simmering basket under warm water, until water runs clear and noodles separate.
Remove Varoma, insert simmering basket with noodles, then place Varoma back into position and cook <b>1 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>.

Divide noodles between 6 serving bowls, top with prawn and fish balls and Asian greens. Carefully remove star anise, then distribute broth between serving bowls. Garnish with spring onions and coriander before serving.

hintsAndTricks: Please refer to The Basic Cookbook for the vegetable stock recipe.
Shrimp paste, also known as belachan, can be found in the International aisle of most major supermarkets or at specialty Asian grocers.
